alert.note: Alert for Essex (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 10:36PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Essex and Union counties in northeast New Jersey. * WHEN...Until 145 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1036 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Newark, Elizabeth, Plainfield, Bloomfield, Linden, Orange, Summit, Millburn, Harrison, Caldwell, Clark, Fairfield, Union, East Orange, Irvington, West Orange, Montclair, Belleville, Westfield and Livingston. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
